popt4jlib.GradientDescent

Class FCGThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • popt4jlib.GradientDescent.FCGThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    class FCGThread
extends java.lang.Thread
    auxiliary class implementing the threads that run each optimization attempt of the main FletcherConjugateGradient.optimize(f) method. Not part of the public API.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      • findStepSize

        static double findStepSize(FunctionIntf f,
                           VecFunctionIntf grad,
                           VectorIntf x,
                           double fx,
                           VectorIntf s,
                           double sTg,
                           double fbar,
                           double rho,
                           double sigma,
                           double t1,
                           double t2,
                           double t3,
                           java.util.HashMap p)
        Al-Baali - Fletcher 2-phase (bracketing-sectioning) method for step-size determination in approximate line search. The method is used by other classes as well, namely the PolakRibiereConjugateGradient classes.
        Parameters:
        f - FunctionIntf the function to minimize
        grad - VecFunctionIntf the gradient of the function
        x - VectorIntf the current iterate point
        fx - double the value of f at the current iterate point
        s - VectorIntf the chosen search direction (must be descent direction)
        sTg - double (the inner product <s,grad(x)>)
        fbar - double a user-defined threshold for accepting a value in the bracketing phase of the algorithm
        rho - double the parameter ρ in the Wolfe-Powell conditions
        sigma - double the parameter σ in the Wolfe-Powell conditions
        t1 - double the parameter t1 in the Al-Baali - Fletcher algorithm
        t2 - double the parameter t2 in the Al-Baali - Fletcher algorithm
        t3 - double the parameter t3 in the Al-Baali - Fletcher algorithm
        p - HashMap the parameters for function evaluation as well as any constraint values for the computation of the algorithm
        Returns:
        double the step-size to use in the determination of the next iterate point, or -1 if the computation fails within the given parameter constraints (passed in the last argument)
